subNodes.conversationText: root

Yes?  We should make haste to the encampment.|***gc_journal_entry-->NOT::False    String::Q_MANFRED    String::<20    ***gc_local_int-->NOT::True    String::ianth_talk    String::2    String::ianth    |
Tell me more about yourself, Ianth.|***ga_local_int-->String::ianth_talk    String::++    String::ianth    |
I do not have much to say.  I am of Tethyr, but my true home now is the Order of the Ruby Rose.  I came to Drawn Swords last year on a pilgrimage to the Flame Stone, a site sacred to my goddess.
As you can see, the pilgrimage lasted much longer than I intended.
Hamfast mentioned that you knew something about the monsters of Northdark Wood.  What should I be expecting?
Goblins and wild animals roam the woods, as do trolls in the deeper parts.  Orcs are occasionally seen, but they tend to prefer the mountains and the Backlands proper.
I am a follower of Sune as well.|***gc_deity-->NOT::False    String::sune    |
Truly?  Then perhaps the goddess has seen fit that we travel together, at least for a time.
Tell me more about the Order of the Ruby Rose.|***ga_local_int-->String::ianth_talk    String::++    String::ianth    |

We believe that truth and beauty are the principal virtues, and we fight to protect the gentler blessings of civilization--art, refinement, and especially love.  We oppose hate, destruction, and bigotry.
Do you find it fulfilling?
[Taken aback for a moment.] Why, yes...Those who have felt the grace of Sune know that truth, beauty, and love are real things.
I do not doubt that they are real, but I do not know if you can fight for them in the same way you can fight for gold or land.|***ga_global_int-->String::ianth_inf    String::++    |
Perhaps that is true.  And yet without ideals for which to strive, there is little to distinguish our motivations from those of beasts and monsters.
In any case, I am glad that your question was not meant to insult me.
I simply mean that while those things sound good, the conflicting motivations and desires of people tend to confuse them.|***ga_global_int-->String::ianth_inf String::++ |
[Shrug.] You have your beliefs. Thank you for sharing them.
Ah.  Then it seems as if we have similar ideas about the things in this life that comprise goodness.|***ga_global_int-->String::moral    String::++    |
I am glad to hear that you agree.|***ga_global_int-->String::ianth_inf    String::++    |
Interesting.  Thank you.
Of course, <FirstName>.
Not my sort of thing, really, but I'm always glad to hear about other people's misguided efforts.|***ga_global_int-->String::ironic    String::++    |
[Ianth simply regards you cooly.]
[Smarmily.] "Especially love," eh?|***gc_is_male-->NOT::False |
[Deflecting the implication.] Yes, especially love. The world is not kind to true love.
Let's keep moving.

Not now.  We must do what we can about the Zhentarim.|***gc_journal_entry-->NOT::False    String::Q_MANFRED    String::<20    ***gc_local_int-->NOT::False    String::ianth_talk    String::2    String::ianth    |
You know, <FirstName>, we really ought to tell Hamfast about the military portfolio as soon as we can.|***gc_journal_entry-->NOT::False    String::Q_MANFRED    String::20    |

Let us talk later.  In the mean time, shouldn't we be making haste back to Hamfast with the news of Darkhold's fall?|***gc_journal_entry-->NOT::False    String::Q_MANFRED    String::20    ***gc_local_int-->NOT::False    String::ianth_talk    String::2    String::ianth    |
I am looking forward to dining with Hamfast.  His wife is an excellent cook, and we all have much to discuss.|***gc_journal_entry-->NOT::False    String::Q_MANFRED    String::25    |
What is it, <FirstName>?|***gc_journal_entry-->NOT::False    String::Q_MANFRED    String::30    ***gc_journal_entry-->NOT::False    String::Q_MANFRED    String::35    |
What was your life in Tethyr like?

My father was Duke Lavillus of Zazesspur.  I was an only child and my father's closest family, my mother having passed away shortly after I was born.  It is an understatement to say that I was doted on.
So the stories that you come from great privilege are true.
Yes.  I am not shy about saying so, but I hope that I have proven myself independent enough by now.  It was not always so.
What do you mean?
Like many people who grew up with privilege, I took it for granted.  And I suppose it might have given me the wrong ideas about the way the world works--I have learned to expect less.
I am curious, Ianth.  Tell me more about your father.|***ga_global_int-->String::ianth_inf    String::++    |
He is a kind, kind man, loved by his friends and servants.  He is now somewhat old, and I regret that my duty has separated us.

Unfortunately, my father was not loved by many of his countrymen. He had always been a patron of the church of Sune, for example, and brought me up with those values--not the prevailing values of the church of Tyr. Many of Zazesspur's noblemen considered him eccentric, even immoral.
This was a mixed blessing.  My youth was probably more wayward than it should have been.  It is easy to misunderstand Sune's teachings when one is young...But enough.
Interesting.  I suppose we should keep moving.
Do you want to tell me anything more about Marcellus?

No. [Ianth looks distraught for a moment, and then reconsiders.] Or...yes. I will say only that--despite his hideous allegiances--I will not draw steel against him if we happen to find ourselves his enemies. But I cannot prevent you, I know.
Why don't you just tell me, Ianth?  What is the story between you and this man?
[Bristling.] , I do not need to tell you anything. I have already told you far more than you need to know. I am done with this talk.|***gc_global_int-->NOT::False String::ianth_inf String::<2 |
Fine.
But--
Wait--
[Sighing.] I have already so much as told you that we--that I was in love with him. There is not much more that needs to be said on the subject, and I think that sufficiently justifies my position.
No, Ianth. I need to know the whole story. He is working for the enemy.
[Bristling.] , I do not need to tell you anything. I have already told you far more than you need to know. I am done with this talk.
Fine.
But--
Wait--
As you wish, then.  Onward.|***ga_global_int-->String::ianth_inf    String::++    |
I see that the subject troubles you.  Let me ask you something else.|***ga_global_int-->String::sympathetic    String::++    ***ga_global_int-->String::ianth_inf    String::++    |
Thank you for understanding.
On second thought, I suppose we have talked enough for now.  Onward.
Nothing.  Let us go.
You wish to speak again?  What is it?|***gc_journal_entry-->NOT::False    String::Q_MANFRED    String::30    ***gc_journal_entry-->NOT::False    String::Q_MANFRED    String::35    |
We need to report the Cyricist attack to Hamfast as soon as possible.  As for Marcellus...we can discuss that later.|***gc_journal_entry-->NOT::False    String::Q_MANFRED    String::40    |

Events have taken an unusual turn, haven't they?  All of this time spent in Drawn Swords, and I had no inkling that the Harpers exercised such influence over the place.  Are you going to join them?|***gc_journal_entry-->NOT::False    String::Q_MANFRED    String::50    |
I am considering it, but haven't yet made up my mind.
I think the Harpers would approve.  This is probably a decision you shouldn't take lightly or make hastily.
Indeed, I will.
I admire your resolution.

When I took my oath as a Knight of the Ruby Rose, I possessed merely what I thought was resolution and discipline. The idealism is easy; it's the struggle to maintain a set of ideals that comes with toil.
You continue to strive, Ianth.  Most people do not even do that.|***ga_global_int-->String::sympathetic    String::++    |

Perhaps that is true, and yet I have lived far too long by defining myself against what others do. I would rather define myself against an ideal. If I am being tested--well, I suppose that is what being tested means.
Resolution can really only be called resolution once it has been tested.|***ga_global_int-->String::moral    String::++    |
But who determines the test?  The gods?  Our oaths?  Ourselves?  Perhaps knowing would make things easier; but, of course, I doubt the test is meant to be easy.
In any case, I suppose we should cease talking about our business and get back to it.|***ga_global_int-->String::ianth_inf    String::++    |
Do you think you are winning the struggle?

It is hard to say, <FirstName>, very hard to say.  I do not think it is for me to know.  I am being tested, I am certain of that--just as you are or will be, if you decide in the end to go with the Harpers.
[Sighing.] I suppose I should have expected you to bring the conversation back to yourself.
And I suppose I should have expected you to bring the conversation to an end without any decorum whatsoever. Enough. You needn't talk to me if you don't wish it.
|***ga_global_int-->String::ianth_inf    String::0    |
No, I would rather walk my own path.
[Shrug/] Perhaps, perhaps not.
Ianth nods back to you, but seems to be lost in thought.|***gc_journal_entry-->NOT::False String::Q_MANFRED String::50 ***gc_global_int-->NOT::False String::ianth_inf String::!0 |
Ianth regards you cooly before turning away.|***gc_journal_entry-->NOT::False String::Q_MANFRED String::50 ***gc_global_int-->NOT::False String::ianth_inf String::0 |

So we are all Harper friends now.  Again, I wonder at how circumstance brought us together and into this adventure together.  What appears to be merely circumstance is often design in disguise. |***gc_journal_entry-->NOT::False    String::Q_MANFRED    String::55    |
The Harpers are not to be trusted--is that what you mean?|***gc_global_int-->NOT::False    String::ianth_inf    String::>    |

I do not mistrust the motives of Those Who Harp, but their ways are not as entirely clear to me as I would like.  Still, as Sune's paladins say, "Straight is the line of duty; Curved is the line of beauty"--
"Follow the straight line and thou shalt see--The curved line ever follows thee."
That sounds familiar.  Is it only Knights of the Ruby Rose who say this?
In truth, it is a saying we adopted from the writings of Bard Blixen.  But the feeling was ours before the language to describe it was.

<color=green>[Lore] Hmm...No offense meant, but I do not believe that the Order of the Ruby Rose invented that little verse.</color>|***gc_skill_dc-->NOT::False    Int::13    Int::25    ***gc_check_class-->NOT::False    Int::1    |
You are quite well-read if you know it.|***ga_give_xp-->Int::100    Int::0    |
Duty is, then, only a matter of perception--and the Harpers have different ways of perceiving it than you.
Indeed.  I like to think that my duty as a knight of the goddess of beauty gives me an advantage over those who would perceive duty as an end in itself and the Harpers mere rabble-rousers.
But I suppose we should get back to Drawn Swords, yes?  Let's move on.
Poetical rubbish.|***ga_global_int-->String::abrasive    String::++    |

Do you think so?  It surprises me to hear you say such a thing.|***gc_global_int-->NOT::False    String::ianth_romance    String::1    ***gc_global_int-->NOT::False    String::ianth_inf    String::>5    |
I meant nothing by it; I apologize.  Let's keep moving.
Don't question me, Ianth.  That's how I feel.|***ga_global_int-->String::ianth_inf    String::1    ***ga_global_int-->String::ianth_romance    String::0    |
[Shrug.] I'm full of surprises.
[Looking dissatisfied.] Good to know, I suppose. Hmm...Let us be on our way.|***ga_global_int-->String::ianth_inf String::-- |
It does not surprise me to hear you say that. [Sighing.] Let us move on.
[Nod silently and think the poem over.]
Circumstance or design, we are in this together, and that's what matters right now.
I feel much the same way. It is vaguely unsettling, but does not feel wrong.
I do not trust those schemers a bit.|***ga_global_int-->String::abrasive    String::++    |
[Shrug.] I don't know.

So you now count yourself a member of the Harpers.  It seems appropriate--Yet I wonder how strange it is that circumstance brought us together, and then brought you to them.  What appears to be circumstance is often design in disguise.|***gc_journal_entry-->NOT::False    String::Q_MANFRED    String::60    |
That is true.  I joined the Harpers so that I could not only be a part of the design, but a maker of it.
[Smiling.] Then I now have you to fear and doubt as well!
We must discover what exactly happened to Anselm as soon as possible.|***gc_journal_entry-->NOT::False    String::Q_MANFRED    String::65    |
This is dreadful, just dreadful.  We need to tell Hamfast about Anselm's murder as soon as we can.|***gc_journal_entry-->NOT::False    String::Q_MANFRED    String::70    |
I have shed my tears, <FirstName>.  If you are trying to console me--|***gc_journal_entry-->NOT::False    String::Q_MANFRED    String::80    |
Yes.  I wanted to remind you, Ianth, that I am here for you.

I--I know, <FirstName>.  Yet I must have some time to mull over these events.  Marcellus was there when my father was on the brink of death, when I first felt Sune's charge, when I first felt the pangs of love--|***gc_global_int-->NOT::False    String::ianth_romance    String::1    |
It will not be easy for me to sacrifice the memory of what he was to the truth of what he became.
Do not trouble yourself about me, <FirstName>.
Nay, Ianth.  I know you are strong enough to stand on your own.

You have stood by me all this time.  You know what to say, <FirstName>, to make me at least feel somewhat like my old self.  My thanks.|***gc_global_int-->NOT::False    String::ianth_inf    String::>5    |
[Trying to appear resolute.] We must speak to Hamfast about this. Do not worry yourself: I am not given to more than one outburst of grief a day.
Then let us move on.  I have much to think over.  In case you are worried, I am not given to more than one outburst of grief a day.
[Shake your head.] No, that was not what I wanted to talk about.

We have no time to talk--at least, not now.  The Flame Stone must be protected.|***gc_journal_entry-->NOT::False    String::Q_MANFRED    String::85    ***gc_journal_entry-->NOT::False    String::Q_MANFRED    String::90    |
Onward.  There is much to do.
